texts: The sun had set, and it was getting cold.
The milk tea I bought was already lukewarm.
Hm? Wind just sent me something. Probably nothing worthwhile. I had bigger fish to fry, anyway...

texts: That response she gave earlier was still getting to me...

options.chara: 汎用_ウィンド情報アプリ

texts: She took advantage of me, but when I actually offered a helping hand, she refused it. What was up with that?

options.chara: 汎用_ウィンド情報アプリ

texts: I thought I was being cool, but suddenly I felt lame as hell.

options.chara: 汎用_ウィンド情報アプリ

texts: It wasn't like I was expecting a reward for my help, but I still had trouble accepting the situation.

options.chara: 汎用_ウィンド情報アプリ

texts: All I could do now was make sure she got home safe.
Not like I knew where she lived, though.
...I could call my graper, at least.
It could self-drive all the way here.
The midsummer sun smiles and beams...
At the cheer invited by the southern wind...
A wondrous magic will soon show its gleams...
The omen of tears...and joy undimmed...
It wasn't the first time she'd said that. Was this, like, her favorite poem or something?
How does it go after that?
Her question was so abrupt it actually threw me off.
I went ahead and ran a quick search for it...
Is it from a book or something?
Momo tilted her head. She didn't even know herself.
I can look it up for ya if you'd like. I'm a pro at this kinda thing.
I can post about it on 4chan. Someone there should know it.
I had faith in the internet's collective knowledge.
Momo put her hands to her forehead, as if shocked by something.
Her eyes were twitching. She was looking right at me, but it was like she was seeing through me—seeing something...far away.
She suddenly grabbed hold of my arm.
We need to run! If we stay here any longer—

scenes.label: *storehis
texts: Before I could even process what was happening, we were surrounded by a bunch of tough-looking guys.
Some of them even had guns.
You're coming with us, little lady.
The guy I guessed was their leader, the muscular foreigner, reached out to grab Momo.
His eyes fixed on me. His glare was so intense it made me shudder.
So what was this all about?
What coulda gotten a goddamn army involved?
Whatever. There was only one thing I could do—hold my ground and refuse to let them intimidate me.
Guys, guys. What are y'all doing, crowding 'round a girl like this? Kinda lame, no? Let's settle down and talk this out like gentleme—
I felt a sudden, intense blow to my body.
The wind rushed out of my chest as I crumpled into a heap.
Come with us. Cooperate and we won't hurt you.
The tatted baldy-builder grabbed Momo by the throat and raised her up, just like that.
She struggled desperately to escape as her legs flailed above the ground.
But my chest hurt like hell. I wheezed as I struggled to catch my breath.
Still, I did all I could to get a handle on the situation.
I did a quick headcount and figured there were 11 people—all of them soldiers.
I didn't stand a chance against them in a straight fight.
It was pretty damn obvious what I had to do!
I slipped my hand into my pocket.
Navigating with my fingertips alone, I used the keyboard to activate my hacking tool.
I started hijacking the local power company's system.
All I had to do was find Nakano's power supply system, induce a malfunction in the closest switch, and...
Hey, don't try anything funny. Hands outta your pockets.
I switched off the surrounding lights.
Switch your BMI to night-vision mode.
I switched my ride from self-driving mode to remote-control mode.
With its headlight burning bright, I had it burst into the park all dramatically.
Next, I had it go straight toward that hulking brute...
Just before it connected, I turned it sideways, setting up a delicious donut turn.
The bastard flinched and let go of Momo.
I grabbed her and jumped on my ride.
Then I took the keyboard out and set it in the socket on the handle. This was my graper driving style.
My graper was purring in no time.
Hearing that scared the hell outta me.
The soldier guys rushed to surround us, but I broke out, ready to run them over if I had to.
Once we got outta the park, I headed for Nakano Station.
I'm sorry, but I've been hiding something from you!
It explained why she'd used me—to lose her pursuers.
Just who exactly are you?! Why's the army hunting you down, for Christ's sake?!
I didn't expect this to happen on my second day in Japan, either!
Are you a VIP from some other country?!
Please, you'd be better off not knowing anything more!
I knew I shouldn't have dragged you into this!
You're still gonna be like that?!
I said you can count on me, remember?!
I called my ride-or-die, and he answered right away.
Yo, Romeo. Your Juliet dump you already?
Now's not the time for that! The army's on our tail!
...Is her father an officer in the armed forces?
I hadn't even considered that possibility. Was she the daughter of some high-ranking army person? A military brat on the loose?
The situation seemed way more serious than that, but I figured I'd check, just in case.
You got any military people in your family?
I noticed that the road leading to Nakano Station was real congested.
It wasn't even rush hour yet, so it was weird for there to be so much traffic already.
Cross, we're being chased by actual soldiers. I'm getting away on my graper, so send me Nakano's traffic data.
Better give me the details when you get back.
My partner was always the type to help first and ask questions later. I always appreciated that about him.
I turned to look behind me.
Two drones shot out of an alley and flew straight at us.
I could tell they were military drones, which meant we were still in their sights.
I drove into a side-alley to dodge the congestion.
Something's going on. The major streets have been blockaded.
There is rumor that the army set these up without notifying the local officials or the police.
Why were they so desperate to catch Momo?
I'm gettin' outta Nakano! Show me the blockades on the map!
The main routes were closed, huh?
Not like that would stop me. I was born and raised in Nakano. It was like my own backyard, I had every back-alley memorized.
Getting out while dodging the blockades would be a cinch.
But first, I had to lose the drones.
They were automatic, so they couldn't be all that adaptive.
I changed some of the graper's settings using the keyboard on my handle.
Now it'd prioritize acceleration and maneuverability over speed.
I'm goin' right through the bar district.
You serious?! That place must be packed with people!
Yeah, but it was also winding and confusing, and my only shot at losing those drones.
Mixed in with the smell of sweat, a pleasant scent tingled my nose. I felt something soft too, but this wasn't the time for that!
I'll show you what I got!
They'd messed up by throwing down on my turf! Time to show these chumps what an underground graper racer could really do!
